panels.description:
Current instance count per project across the selected hypervisors (oie_instance_info).

Source: OIE inventory/mapping metrics emitted by the exporter (instance/project/user labels derived on the hypervisor).
Limitations: Reflects what OIE can map at collection time; labels can be temporarily stale during rebuilds/migrations or if OpenStack metadata is unavailable. Counts are not traffic-based.
panels.title: Instance Count by Project | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total RAM allocated per project in MB (sum of assigned memory across all instances on selected hypervisors).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead.

targets.expr:
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (
  label_replace(
    oie_instance_mem_allocated_mb{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid",             project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name" },
    "mem_mb_num",
    "$1",
    "mem_mb",
    "([0-9]+)"
  )
)

panels.title: RAM Allocation by Project | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total vCPUs allocated per project (sum of vCPU count across all instances on selected hypervisors).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr:
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (
  label_replace(
    oie_instance_cpu_vcpu_count{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid",             project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name" },
    "vcpus_num",
    "$1",
    "vcpus",
    "([0-9]+)"
  )
)

panels.title: vCPUs Allocation by Project | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total Stall (Steal + Wait) seconds per second across all instances in the project. Indicates quality of service degradation.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_cpu_steal_seconds_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_cpu_wait_seconds_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))

panels.title: Project Stall Time (Steal/Wait) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Average vs Max attention severity. Max reveals if a single instance is critical despite a low project average.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: avg by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_attention_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_attention_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Attention (Avg vs Max) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Max severity per resource axis within the project. Identifies if the project has a CPU, Mem, Disk, or Net bottleneck.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Severities are normalized 0–100 (higher = worse) and are heuristic/threshold-based, intended for ranking rather than exact accounting.

targets.expr: max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_cpu_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_mem_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_disk_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_net_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Resource Breakdown (Max) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Max severity per component (Resource, Behavior, Threat). Shows what is driving the attention score.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Severities are normalized 0–100 (higher = worse) and are heuristic/threshold-based, intended for ranking rather than exact accounting.

targets.expr: max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_behavior_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
max by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_threat_list_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Severity Composition (Max) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Actionable triage: which instance(s) are driving project attention right now.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: topk(20, oie_instance_attention_severity{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Top Instances by Attention (Top 20) | PN/PU/IU:

panels.description:
Average resource severity per axis (CPU/Mem/Disk/Net) across instances in the selected project. Use this to see which resource dimension is driving project load.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Severities are normalized 0–100 (higher = worse) and are heuristic/threshold-based, intended for ranking rather than exact accounting.

targets.expr: avg by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_cpu_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
avg by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_mem_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
avg by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_disk_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
avg by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_resource_net_severity{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Resource Breakdown (Avg) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Projects where at least one instance in the project has attention severity ≥ 60 during the selected time range. (Project value is the max instance attention severity in that project.)

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hot Projects (Attention >= 60) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Projects where at least one instance in the project has attention severity ≥ 85 during the selected time range. (Project value is the max instance attention severity in that project.)

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Hot Projects (Attention >= 85) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project CPU usage as a share of that project's allocated vCPUs.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: CPU Efficiency (Used/Allocated %) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total virtual disk capacity vs actual host allocation per project.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk allocation/capacity are provisioned/virtual sizes. On thin-provisioned backends, backend consumed bytes can differ; snapshots/COW and discard/TRIM behavior can affect reclamation.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_disk_capacity_bytes{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_disk_allocation_bytes{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Disk Capacity vs Allocation | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project live guest memory usage as a percentage of that project's allocated memory. Low values indicate over-provisioning.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead. Memory 'used' here is hypervisor-observed usage (not the guest OS free/used breakdown) and can be affected by ballooning and QEMU overhead.
panels.title: Memory Efficiency (Used/Allocated %) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total Allocated RAM minus Total Used RAM (Guest View). Represents potential waste.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. RAM allocation is provisioned/configured (scheduler/accounting), not guest 'used'. Clouds may overcommit RAM (e.g., allocation ratios), and this excludes some host overhead. Memory 'used' here is hypervisor-observed usage (not the guest OS free/used breakdown) and can be affected by ballooning and QEMU overhead.

targets.expr:
sum by (project_name, project_uuid) (oie_instance_mem_allocated_mb{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
-
sum by (project_name, project_uuid) (oie_instance_mem_used_mb{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Unused RAM (Allocated - Used) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated disk read throughput per project (GB/s) across all instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Project Disk Read Throughput | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated disk write throughput per project (GB/s) across all instances.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Project Disk Write Throughput | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total disk read volume per project over the last 1 minute (short-window) (GB), from oie_instance_disk_read_gbytes_total.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Project Disk Read Total | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total disk write volume per project over the last 1 minute (short-window) (GB), from oie_instance_disk_write_gbytes_total.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.
panels.title: Project Disk Write Total | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated disk read IOPS per project (read requests per second across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.

targets.expr: (sum by (project_name, project_uuid) (rate(oie_instance_disk_read_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m])))

panels.title: Project Disk Read IOPS | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated disk write IOPS per project (write requests per second across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.

targets.expr: (sum by (project_name, project_uuid) (rate(oie_instance_disk_write_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m])))

panels.title: Project Disk Write IOPS | PN/PU:

panels.description:
IO-weighted average disk latency across the project.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.

targets.expr:
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_read_seconds_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))
/
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_read_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_write_seconds_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))
/
sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_write_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))

panels.title: Project Disk Latency (IO Weighted) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project-wide Flush vs Write IOPS. High Flush rates indicate sync-heavy workloads.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky. Disk I/O counters are cumulative and typically visualized as rates; they may not include backend replication/cluster overhead.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_flush_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (rate(oie_instance_disk_write_requests_total{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[1m]))

panels.title: Project Flush vs Write IOPS | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated inbound packet rate per project (RX packets per second across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Network RX Packets per Second | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated outbound packet rate per project (TX packets per second across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Network TX Packets per Second | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated inbound network throughput per project (Gbps from RX traffic across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Network RX Throughput | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Aggregated outbound network throughput per project (Gbps from TX traffic across all instances).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Network TX Throughput | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Total Flows.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_conntrack_ip_flows{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Conntrack Total Flows | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Flows per Project.

Source: OIE inventory/mapping metrics emitted by the exporter (instance/project/user labels derived on the hypervisor).
Limitations: Reflects what OIE can map at collection time; labels can be temporarily stale during rebuilds/migrations or if OpenStack metadata is unavailable. Counts are not traffic-based.
panels.title: Project Conntrack Flows per Project | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Inbound Connections.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_conntrack_ip_flows_inbound{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Conntrack Inbound Connections | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Outbound Connections.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name) (oie_instance_conntrack_ip_flows_outbound{instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

panels.title: Project Conntrack Outbound Connections | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Capacity Share (%).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Conntrack Capacity Share (%) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Project Conntrack Usage Share (%).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Project Conntrack Usage Share (%) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Top Instances by Conntrack Flows (Top 20).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Top Instances by Conntrack Flows (Top 20) | PN/PU/IU:

panels.description:
Inbound fan-in: how many distinct remotes are hitting the instance (worst fixed-IP identity per instance).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Inbound Unique Remotes (Top 20 Instances) | PN/PU/IU:

panels.description:
Outbound reach: how many distinct remotes an instance is touching (worst fixed-IP identity per instance).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.
panels.title: Outbound Unique Remotes (Top 20 Instances) | PN/PU/IU:

panels.description:
New threat-list contact events (delta) across this project over the selected window.

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (increase(oie_instance_threat_spamhaus_contacts_total{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (increase(oie_instance_threat_tor_exit_contacts_total{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (increase(oie_instance_threat_tor_relay_contacts_total{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (increase(oie_instance_threat_emergingthreats_contacts_total{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (increase(oie_instance_threat_customlist_contacts_total{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Threat New Contacts Rate by List (Project) | PN/PU:

panels.description:
Total active flows currently matching each threat list (summed across instances in this project).

Source: Libvirt/QEMU stats collected on the hypervisor by OIE (plus derived scoring).
Limitations: Host-side view of VM counters; guest OS reporting may differ. Counters can reset on VM reboot/migration; short rate windows can be spiky.

targets.expr: sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (oie_instance_threat_spamhaus_active_flows{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})

sum by (project_uuid, project_name, direction) (oie_instance_threat_tor_exit_active_flows{job="openstack-instance-exporter", instance=~"$gvar_oie_hypervisor.*", project_uuid=~"$gvar_oie_project_uuid", project_name=~"$gvar_oie_project_name"})
